intro: Sida pediculariifolia, commonly known as the smallleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open areas such as roadsides and fields. Sida pediculariifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
